from what i can see, best broker is always the first choice, if not exist, the second best is ok

> from what i can see, best broker is always the first choice, if not exist, the second best is ok

I agree with your option about choosing the right broker.But when we talk about Broker latency fault mechanism,I think we should avoid choosing the new messagequeue in the same Broker which occur something wrong.So I think the right logic is “!my.getBrokerName().equals(lastBrokerName)”

Since channelTables is a ConcurrentHashMap, ConcurrentHashMap cannot be put into a null value otherwise it will cause NPE, so NPE will not happen here.

> Since channelTables is a ConcurrentHashMap, ConcurrentHashMap cannot be put into a null value otherwise it will cause NPE, so NPE will not happen here.

There is no plan for DefaultLitePullConsumer to provide a method to query messages by offset. But we can still accomplish the same function through other methods such as using mqadmin tool. And the  community hopes that DefaultLitePullConsumer can replace DefaultMQPullConsumer in the future

忘了这个issue了，我们当时改源码解决了
由于 我们是单机环境，也不需要同步和delay，所以把写文件这块 注释掉了，重新打包，替换 应用中jar包，这样解决的

修改代码如下图：

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5234760/90202449-54b1c180-de10-11ea-99dd-3223ae709cf6.png)

这边去年底临时解决了这个问题，在issue上回复了

> RocketMQ has an expired file deletion mechanism. If the non-currently written commitlog file is not updated again within a certain time interval, it is considered an expired file and RocketMQ will automatically delete it.
> By default, each file has an expiration time of 72 hours, and the expiration time is modified by setting `fileReservedTime` in the Broker configuration file.
> 
> RocketMQ 有过期文件删除机制，非当前写的 commitlog 文件在一定时间间隔内没有再次被更新，则被认为是过期文件，RocketMQ 会自动删除。
> 默认每个文件的过期时间为 72 个小时，通过在 Broker 配置文件中设置`fileReservedTime`来修改过期时间，单位为小时。

Is there a way I can reduce the time to 5 minutes?

I tried fileReservedTime of 0.1 (roughly 6 min) but consumer still got the messages after 10 mins.

What does deleteWhen do? 

Is it an interval or time of the day?

Every Broker has a config about topic named **topics.json** at dir **${storePathRootDir}/config/**.
Maybe that's what u want.

Coverage increased (+0.01%) to 51.208% when pulling **4148c602c57250d8a983ec0b48d0fac770e51e53 on fantow:fix_issue#2237** into **a093f8a638f1a1329b0c7567bf38e8590fa668f8 on apache:develop**.

> we encounter this question too，the rocketmq version is 4.5.1。
> But when we install the version to another server，the question goes away，interesting。
> Did you slove it?

After two day later, we sloved it。
The question is about delayOffset.json。As you know，the broker process persist SCHEDULE_TOPIC_XXXX offset to delayOffset.json。When we drop the store folder，we didn't noticed it generate a store/config folder automatic by broker。Whereafter，we reset broker，but the offset from delayOffset not matched the offset from SCHEDULE_TOPIC_XXXX，so the message in SCHEDULE_TOPIC_XXXX cannot enter %RETRY% topic。
DLedger mode is supported starting from version 4.5.0.
Broker is listening on 10911 by default, curious when does broker need to listen on port 11011 and why client tries to connect to port 11011. Did you change to broker to listen on 11011 ?
i meet the same problem，when will support this future @RongtongJin
